title: So Riot, can we discuss why you guys refuse to acknowledge Zed's power?
body: Seriously, you guys have not said a single thing about him and how he's pretty much worse than Talon ever was in terms of counterplay and Talon wasn't even picked much before you guys removed the silence, and he was one of the few that could go against Zed. So what's the deal? Why won't you guys look into it and all the complaints against him?

replies.body:
Zed's strong when well played, no argument, particular when picked into the right matchups/with the right team. Because of the delay and need for follow up on his ult's initial cast however his all in combo gives his target a number of options. They can activate defensive items/effects, try and get away from Zed so he can't stack up damage, kill (or at least damage) him, reposition before he reappears to try put him in a position where he has to get out immediately etc. 

Talon by contrast when he had his silence executed his entire combo very quickly leaving the enemy unable to respond apart from a second or so of basic attacks and slow movement. As a result we felt changing Talon was necessary - he's not able to cover as much distance quickly as Zed can, but with a silence he shut down too many of the basic responses to an assassin diving onto you.

> Talon by contrast when he had his silence executed his entire combo very quickly leaving the enemy unable to respond apart from a second or so of basic attacks and slow movement. As a result we felt changing Talon was necessary - he's not able to cover as much distance quickly as Zed can, but with a silence he shut down too many of the basic responses to an assassin diving onto you.

My only real beef with this take is that y'all have this annoying tendency to see a low counterplay pattern, nerf it through the floor, and then leave that champion in a useless, broken state for a length of time that even Valve thinks is excessive.

See also Olaf, Urgot, and most notably LeBlanc, who got the identical treatment as Talon and hasn't been seen since.

After the talon nerf I've seen him a couple of times in my ranked games and he's dominated every single time. I'm not gonna say he's super effective in any matchup at any given point of the game (See older Lee Sin), but he's still a good pick depending on the matchup and team comp

TL:DR: 
"Zed is the best designed assassin to date" argument again.

Don't get me wrong, I think the champion is fantastic, and I enjoy playing him, but he's not nearly as perfect as you guys seem to believe he is every time he's brought up. 

He's the only assassin who you guys *don't* dumpster, and I think that's in no small part because every rioter that talks about him only ever seems to say "oh he's the pinnacle of assassin design" without ever acknowledging his overbearing strengths or snowballing, even though *every other* assassin has to suffer dearly for the exact same traits.

I just wish you guys would be consistent. He's no less an assassin playstyle than others, but he's the only one you won't dumpster, which means assassins aren't the problem: Riot's perception of them is. You have favorites. Unfortunately only one of your favorites is an assassin, which is why he's always strong compared to the rest of them who get nerfed over and over.

> Zed's strong when well played, no argument, particular when picked into the right matchups/with the right team. Because of the delay and need for follow up on his ult's initial cast however his all in combo gives his target a number of options. They can activate defensive items/effects, try and get away from Zed so he can't stack up damage, kill (or at least damage) him, reposition before he reappears to try put him in a position where he has to get out immediately etc.

Since 99% of this applyes to Yasuo too (while Yasuo has far worse escape mechanics and has to stick longer on targets to get the same damage of a Zed) why has he been nerfed so much?

Note, I'm not whining on all the tuning he had but the last ones (HP and Movement Speed
) where really unjustified.

Yasuo had an extremely powerful early game (strong lane bully, easy pushing, moderate roam potential, difficult to gank) coupled with a potentially strong midgame (knockup setups at drag/blue) and a huge late game (teamfight powerhouse, great scaling). They nerfed his early laning power so that his weaknesses are actual weaknesses, instead of easily being shored up by the near-guaranteed gold he could get.

> Yasuo had an extremely powerful early game (strong lane bully, easy pushing, moderate roam potential, difficult to gank) coupled with a potentially strong midgame (knockup setups at drag/blue) and a huge late game (teamfight powerhouse, great scaling). LOL. Difficult to gank?? Like wow. No. I've ganked many Yasuos, in normals and in rank, and made them go like 2/11 or 2/13. I remember I ganked this one Yasuo. Got him killed. He decided to walk back in lane again, I decided to gank again and get him killed. or even when I'm Fizz and face him in lane, he gets destroyed. Honestly, I don't see why they made Yasuo really weak now. To me, he was finally balanced when they fixed his retarded 5,000 shield damage that lasted for 2 years and was up every second or two. Once his shield wasn't as much a problem as it was on release, he was A LOT easier to face against from then on. I could finally beat him without that retarded shield lasting so long and taking up so much damage.

I didn't find anything of him so powerful though, and I've been fighting against him many times. Probably because I played him a lot too I know what he can and what he can't do and what mistakes ppl do:

1) Melees try to keep distance because they are afraid of his first 2 Qs and then they will get the 3rd tim to time allowing him to free farm ignoring that they can outscale him either by tankiness/sustain or by damage/sustain.

2) Rangeds keep waiting for QWER him without luring the wall first and then they get pissed of if a decent Yasuo uses it to save his arse. They ignore that: most of their skills won't be blocked anyway (I saw ppl claiming that Yasuo wall was OP trying to Wind Wall my Xerath's Q... ), they can make his shield pop up at will leaving him defenseless.

Any1 who practiced either with or against Yasuo agrees that he is more than controllable and suffers from the same issues that other melee carries do. I've never said that he is weak and I kinda agreed with most of the small nerfs he had and the buff (Shield reset after ulti), I just don't understand why would you make him the weakest in lane when enemies can jump on him and win already (you won't have an easy Q stacking before you build at least Zerker Greaves).

Also, Zed has a far easier way of dealing damage. I want to remeber that he has a point&click ultimate that alsos erves as a gap closer. Similar to this other melee carries and Assas have ultimates that can be used at will while Yasuo has to: hit 2 times a target, hit the 3rd time a telegraphed skillshot or dash into the enemy team, use the ultimate and then stick to the target/s to make use of the passive (if the enemy has armor from runes/masteries/items, if not, the passive is useless).

Fine, but then let us ask you this. Why does an assassin who has the option of killing someone efficiently have such good wave clear? Assassins are supposed to be feast or famine champions, they're supposed to have decent harass and excellent kill potential at level 6, but they're supposed to NEED those kills to stay relevant especially in the mid game. An assassin shouldn't be able to stay mid and farm or split push, he should have to roam and try to catch people out.

If anything, he may have the most counterplay out of every assassin.

Basic counterplay: Dodge his poke.
Basic Death Mark Counterplay: Crowd Control him. 

His damage is more than manageable once you have a Seeker's.
Death Mark becomes a non-issue once you have Zhonya's.

Anyone with long range, mobility, shields/sustain or CC can deal with him easily.
If you put yourself in a position to be picked off for free (i.e.: no CC, away from your turret) you deserved to die.

> Seriously, you guys have not said a single thing about him and how he's pretty much worse than Talon ever was in terms of counterplay

A lack of counterplay doesn't mean a strong pick.

-------

Zed is strong, but he isn't without countermeasures. You can Zhonya's during his ultimate. Or a defensive skill. You can simply move out of the way when he ults so his fallow-up is significantly impaired. You can dodge his shurikens, shadows, and slashes by simply moving out of the way.

------

The issue with Talon is that once he blinked behind and silenced a champion without warning, you can't react in any way outside of turning around and auto-attacking him. 
Which he could opt out of happening if he stealthed immediately afterwards, seeing as stealth grants untargetability against auto-attacks.
Talon's blink is also instant, so there's not much warning he's casting it outside of moving within 700 range of a target (50 further away than Caitlyn's AA).

Silence disables summoner spells (Flash, Barrier), item actives (Zhonya's, Kingblade), as well as abilities.

Talon had none because he could silence you for the duration of his burst. You couldn't use abilities, items, or summoner spells. You were locked in place until he was done with his burst. This led to only being able to sit there and cross your fingers, hoping that he wasn't going to wipe you.

Zed lets you dodge abilities, use summoner spells like flash and exhaust to get away or reduce his damage, use CC abilities to lock him down and fight back, or use Zhyona's and QSS to dodge his ult damage.

If you're going pretend like a champion that lets your fight back is better than a champion that doesn't then I don't think you understand what kind of things are usually considered fair.
You can use summoner spells while silenced/CC'ed the exceptions are flash and teleport so you can exhaust talon while silenced or use barrier/heal
